questions.question: 1.Which of the following does not improve due to strain hardening?
2.An aluminum plate has been rolled from 40 mm to 10 mm (thickness). Assume that width remains same. The % cold working (% CW) is:
3.Given different samples are cold rolled to x % deformation; Sample A: 20 %, Sample B: 30 %, Sample C: 40 %, Sample D: 50 %. Which of the following is correct?

answers.a: % elongation of C > % elongation of D
answers.b: Yield Strength of C < Yield Strength of A
answers.c: Tensile Strength of A > Tensile Strength of D
answers.d: Elastic modulus of B < Elastic modulus of C

questions.question: 4.Which of the following statements is correct w.r.t. strain hardening?

answers.b: It is predominantly based on the addition of alloying elements
answers.c: Hardening occurs predominantly due to plastic deformation
answers.d: It is predominantly related to dislocation-solute interaction

questions.question: 5.Consider an aluminum plate has been subjected to 60 % cold rolling. Rectangular Tensile specimens (thickness: 2 mm and width: 5 mm) were cut from the rolled plate and then subjected to tensile test. If the maximum load noted is 750 N, what would be the ultimate tensile strength?
